page.title: 07The Ashby Canal
page.content: The Ashby Canal is a rich swamp providing a habitat for a great variety of animals and plants.People also use the canal for boating and fishing. Walking by the canal on the 18/6/85, the following flora and fauna were observed.{BIRDS}:Bullfinch,Wren, Kestrel,Long tailed tit,Jay,Chaffinch, Willow Warbler,Willow tit.{INSECTS}: Rain beetle,Froghopper,Horsefly, Wood ant,Water boatman.{MAMMALS}: Grey squirrel,Water vole,Field mouse. {TREES}:Ash,Birch,Oak,Willow,Hazel, Blackberry,Elderberry,Hawthorn,Wild rose.{FLOWERS}:Common Fern,Thistle, Honeysuckle,Water iris,Campion.
